Hello again Martin,
> May first thought was, that in bigger networks it bec=
ames unprobable that connection costs leads to modularity.
> 
I don't see w=
hy the connection cost hypothesis would be less applicable to large network=
s. In fact, I think it becomes stronger as network size increases, because =
the number of possible connections (and their length) scale tremendously as=
 neuron number increases. 
> However, I could imagine that in large network=
s connection costs leads to a hierarchical structure with massive paralleli=
sm at the beginning of the processing stream and more abstract operations a=
t its end (in a some kind of feed-forward network). Would be interesting to=
 observe that in a simulation :)
> 
> 

It would indeed. :0) If you get tha=
t result, please let us know!
--Apple-Mail=_F11A165C-2C37-45C1-9EC6-DD5532E3F0A2
